newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Ag Min cuts 96/97 soy crop to 26 mln tonnes.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Ag Min cuts 96/97 soy crop to 26 mln tonnes.

text.p: Brazil's 1996/97 soybean crop should reach 25.99 million tonnes, according to a press release from the Agriculture Ministry's National Supply Company (Conab).
The estimate is Conab's fourth and compares with a previous forecast of 26.41 million tonnes.
The reduction is due to lower than expected production in the southern state of Rio Grande do Sul which saw a prolonged drought earlier this year, the press release said.
Conab did not however give a breakdown of production by state.
The Conab forecast compares with an estimate of 26.7 million tonnes by the Brazilian Vegetable Oils Industries Association and 26.14 million tonnes by the National Statistics Institute.
Independent analysts Safras e Mercado has previously plotted the crop at 26.22 million tonnes but this is due to be revised next week.

Conab now sees Brazil's total grains and oilseeds crop at 79.41 million tonnes, 2.2 percent lower than its previous forecast of 81.19 million but still eight percent up on the 73.51 million tonnes produced in 1995/96.
Corn output, also hit by the drought in Rio Grande do Sul, is now estimated at 36.55 million tonnes against 37.16 million previously.
